statement: Operating profitability strongly recovered as compared to the last year despite the pandemic.
The Company has not issued any shares with differential voting rights.
The Board of Directors have recommended a final dividend @ 110% i.e. ` 1.10/- per Equity Share.
The total dividend @ 170% on Equity Shares for FY 2021-22 would involve a total cash outflow of ` 60.43 Crores.
The Company has laid down procedures to inform the Audit Committee as well as the Board of Directors regarding loans and investments.
The Company reported a total comprehensive loss of ` 135.37 Crores.
The interim dividend payment involved a cash outflow of ` 39.10 Crores.
The Company incurred a total comprehensive loss of ` 19.29 Crores for the period under review.
The Company has not issued employee stock options nor sweat equity shares.
The Company has not accepted any deposits or amounts which are deemed to be deposits.
The Company plans to extend its initiative to support 50 students by 2027.
The merger shall also result in simplification of the group structure.
The Company expects strong growth opportunities and aims to accelerate the differentiation of its propositions.
The Company is exposed to credit risk from its operating activities and from its financing activities.
The Company evaluates exchange rate exposure arising from foreign currency transactions.
The Company is exposed to interest rate risk with respect to returns realised.
The Company has significant influence in an entity by holding more than 20% of voting rights.
